segments.text: I feel a bit sad looking at this scene.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman seems so alone, even though the kids are right there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's just focused on her chores, not noticing the water or the kids.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she's always this absorbed in her work.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are having their little adventure, but she's missing it all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's like she's in her own world, and the kids are in theirs.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit sorry for her, standing there with water all around her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She seems so disconnected from what's happening around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she realizes that sometimes it's okay to put the chores aside and enjoy the little moments.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's sad to see her missing out on the fun the kids are having.
segments.speaker: PAR
